definition: to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
bored/depressed/melancholy/sealed/airtight/tightly closed
stuffy/shut indoors/to smother/to cover tightly
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Sometimes, he gets so sulky that he just stays in his tent and fasts.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他就只會呆在自己的帳篷裏不喫東西生悶氣。

sentences.english: I often be in the sulks.
sentences.chinese: 我時常一小我私家生悶氣。

sentences.english: A fit of sullens got short shrift in our house.
sentences.chinese: 在我們家生悶氣是沒有人搭理的。

sentences.english: The firm lips pouted in a sulk.
sentences.chinese: 緊閉的雙脣因爲生悶氣撅了起來。

sentences.english: Co Wa Rienk sat there sulking, not to say a word.
sentences.chinese: 柯瓦連科坐在那兒生悶氣，一句話也不說。

sentences.english: Some people are introvert, exceedingly is fuggy , disposition is eccentric, suspicious much Lv.
sentences.chinese: 有些人性格內向，好生悶氣，脾氣古怪，多疑多慮。

sentences.english: I wasn't sulking. I twisted my ankle.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有生悶氣，我只是扭傷了腳踝。

sentences.english: I believe he's sulking in some corner composing a complaint to his superiors.
sentences.chinese: 我相信他會在向上司投訴他遇到困難的時候生悶氣的。

sentences.english: The little girl alternately sulked and made scenes.
sentences.chinese: 這小姑娘一會兒生悶氣，一會兒和人吵架。

sentences.english: I was very angry, he sat on the ice to sulk.
sentences.chinese: 我非常生氣，便坐在冰上生悶氣。

sentences.english: He is in the sulks today.
Don't be in the sulks, let's have it act.
sentences.chinese: 別生悶氣了。我們說出來解決行不行？

sentences.english: That little girl seems to have a fit of the sulks.
sentences.chinese: 那個小女孩似乎在生悶氣。

sentences.english: Santino would have sulked and behaved badly for weeks afterward.
sentences.chinese: 桑蒂諾會生悶氣，並且以後幾個星期表現不好。

definition: to go into a huff
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
docile and obedient/all obedience
to be in a bad mood
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to chatter/to babble
bird's nest
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to look for trouble
(coll.) to enjoy showing off
